hero.intro: I‚Äôm Gibran ‚Äî a Senior Product Manager @ Yourpay, balancing user rants, business wants, designer slants, and developer grunts, and merging it all into production (usually on Fridays). I‚Äôve spent over 4 years with Figma, Jira, and VS Code open on my never-shut-down Mac. When I‚Äôm not optimizing funnels, I‚Äôm optimizing my deadlift or flight itinerary.

experience.title: Here are some of my professional work experiences ...

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
descriptionPreview: Led the Tamasya Squad, overseeing product strategy for the Taiwan, Malaysia, and South Korea markets while owning the upper funnel (leads, registration, verification).

Improved onboarding performance by incorporating OCR technology to streamline data extraction, reduce manual input, and minimize user friction‚Äîresulting in a +14.2% increase in CVR from leads to registration and a +28.4% improvement from registration to verification.
descriptionFull: Reduced user complaints related to registration and verification by 89.3% through UX improvements, clearer guidance, and enhanced error-handling flows.
Launched enhanced verification flows through Face ID integration, strengthening security and reducing fraudulent attempts while keeping friction low.
Accelerated onboarding speed by reducing registration and verification time by 68%, significantly improving the upper funnel.
Introduced a reminder feature prompting users to add their overseas phone number, achieving a +43.9% CVR for this step.
Collaborated closely with engineering, design, and compliance teams‚Äîas well as external stakeholders‚Äîto deliver scalable, regulatory-aligned onboarding experiences across multiple countries.
Accelerated onboarding speed by reducing registration and verification time by 68%, significantly improving the upper funnel.

jobs.title: Lead Product Designer
descriptionPreview: Led the end-to-end creation of the company‚Äôs design system using the Atomic Design framework and tailored it for a software-driven user interface (SDUI), establishing a unified visual language and component library adopted across all product teams.
Successfully migrated and redesigned the entire mobile app from Design 2.0 to 3.0.
Defined scalable UI foundations (tokens, color, typography, spacing, grid systems) and standardized components (buttons, forms, navigation, cards) to ensure consistency and efficiency.
descriptionFull: Collaborated closely with engineering to implement the design system in code, aligning tokens, interaction states, specifications, and accessibility standards.
Reduced design and development time by 34% through reusable components, improved workflows, and comprehensive documentation‚Äîenabling faster and more consistent product delivery.
Championed UX best practices by driving user research, usability testing, A/B testing, and iterative improvements informed by data and user insights.
Provided coaching and mentorship to designers, resulting in one team member‚Äôs promotion to Senior Designer.

Structured and developed the design team by defining clear capability areas‚ÄîUX Research, UX Writing, UI Design, Design System Management, and Illustration‚Äîensuring strong specialization and collaboration.
Led the hiring process for additional designers, strengthening team capacity and elevating overall design quality.

jobs.title: UI/UX Designer Intern
descriptionPreview: Designed user flows and interfaces for LingoTalk and LingoParent across mobile and web, including registration, course enrollment, and homepage pages.
Created wireframes and high-fidelity UIs in Figma, collaborating with UX researchers, illustrators, and UX writers.
descriptionFull: Revamped existing pages to improve clarity, usability, and overall user experience.
Participated in brainstorming, design critiques, and usability testing to support user-centered decision-making.
Partnered with developers to hand off assets, annotate specs, and ensure accurate implementation.

jobs.title: Product Owner
descriptionPreview: Launched two web applications from scratch‚Äîan arcade-games procurement service featuring a crowdfunding scheme and real-time vessel tracking.
Collaborated closely with the Scrum Master and oversaw a cross-functional team (UI/UX, Frontend, Backend, QA) to deliver features efficiently.
descriptionFull: Managed multiple stakeholders, gathered requirements, and translated them into clear user stories and prioritized backlog items aligned with business goals.
Supported Agile/Scrum ceremonies (sprint planning, stand-ups, grooming, retrospectives) and facilitated smooth communication across teams to maintain transparency and alignment.
Monitored feature performance and collected user feedback to identify opportunities for continuous improvement.

items.description: With a major in User Experience Design, I‚Äôve built a diverse mix of experiences across tech, education, and organisational leadership. I‚Äôm also a Global Connect Scholarship awardee. During my uni years, I worked part-time at Officeworks Windsor in IT Sales & Support, assisted coaching at Brisbane Central Futsal, and tutored UQ‚Äôs capstone course Design Computing Studio 3: Build (DECO3801). I also played an active role in the Indonesian student association in Queensland‚Äîserving as President of the AKSI cabinet (2022‚Äì2023) and previously as Head of Marketing & Public Relations (2021‚Äì2022).
